result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Xavier M Hayes

records.addlTxt: NO BAIL WAS POSTED ON THIS CASE.

Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. 
Court grants the request of Regina Hayes, mother of Xavier Hayes. Cash bail posted by the Surety Regina Hayes to be returned FORTHWITH.

Defendant Xavier M Hayes in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Xavier M Hayes.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea and sentencing. Defense advised the court that the defendant's family is hiring a private attorney, believed to be Nicole Muller. Defense move to withdraw. Court takes no action on the defense's motion at this time. Court advised the defendant that if he is retaining private counsel, counsel must appear at the next court date. Court adjourns the plea and sentencing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.
Letter from surety re:  bail refund.
Defendant's Notice of Motion and Motion for Bail Reduction.  (Xavier Hayes - #2021006218, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier M Hayes in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Xavier M Hayes in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Defense counsel advises Court that defendant may have retained other counsel.
Defendant informs Court his family has retained "Nicole" last name unknown as attorney.
During the hearing Court telephones Attorney Nicole Muller who advised Court they have not been retained.

Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.
Defendant is advised that if counsel has been retained that counsel should file a notice of retainer and appear on the next court date.

Per Chief Judge Directive 22-04 effective July 30, 2022, this calendar will be assigned to Judge David Swanson, Branch 11 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.

Clerk:  jms

Notice Of Motion and
Motion To Withdraw As Attorney Of Record
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Xavier M Hayes not in court, in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defendant has three cases before the court.
Defense counsel waives defendant's appearance for purposes of this hearing.
Defense counsel advises Court he received an offer from the State either late yesterday or earlier today and has not been able to review it with the defendant.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

ADDRESS INFO for Xavier M Hayes
Current: 4466 N 28th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53209 United States  (Effective: 03-24-2022)
Prior: W4380 Copperlake Avenue, Irma, WI 54442

Defendant Xavier M Hayes in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Xavier M Hayes in custody.  Alex Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer A. Milone. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28 and remains calendared for 4/6/2022 at 1:30pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court sets bail at $5,000 cash

Turnover to JusticePoint for electronic monitoring

As a further condition of bail:
Defendant is ordered not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.

Defendant Xavier M Hayes (appears via Zoom video) with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris (appears in person).  Defendant Xavier M Hayes in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin (appears in person).
Defendant has three cases before the court.

Initial Appearance held.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  

Court will address bail.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Counsel has not yet been appointed as to this case.
Court will appoint counsel for Defendant.  The Court appoints Attorney Thomas Harris to represent defendant at the rate of $125 per hour;  Attorney Harris present in court and accepted the appointment. 
Court finds that defendant does not have to repay the County.  Order Appointing Counsel to be forwarded to the court for Judge's signature.

Clerk:  jms
